summary: This is an email chain between FBI personnel discussing a new victim of Jeffrey Epstein who has requested therapy sessions. The victim is known to the FBI, having been interviewed previously, and approval is sought for 12 therapy sessions.

persons.name: M.S.
persons.context: A licensed psychotherapist (LMHC) who is requesting approval for therapy sessions for a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as 'Mr. Epstein,' the perpetrator whose actions victimized the individual discussed in the email.

connections.description: M.S. is a psychotherapist seeking to provide treatment to a victim of Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Therapy Request for Epstein Victim
events.description: A psychotherapist requests approval for 12 therapy sessions for a new victim of Jeffrey Epstein, noting the victim had previously been interviewed by the FBI.

events.title: FBI Meeting with Victim
events.description: The FBI met with the victim in person the previous year, and the victim also spoke with a Victim Specialist (VS) in Florida.

keyFacts: A new victim of Jeffrey Epstein has come forward and requested therapy sessions in April 2020.
The victim had previously met with the FBI in person in 2019 and also spoke with a Victim Specialist in Florida.
Approval is being sought for 12 therapy sessions for the victim.
The email correspondence involves FBI personnel from New York (NY) and possibly the Domestic Operations (DO) division.
The document indicates ongoing support and investigation related to Epstein's victims years after his death.
